sentences.english: Increased frequency of droughts and floods would affect local production negatively.
sentences.chinese: 更加频繁的干旱和洪涝将给地方生产带来不利影响。

sentences.english: There is an annual coupling between flood and earthquake.
sentences.chinese: 福建洪涝与强震具有年耦合性。

sentences.english: Finally, the forecast experiments were made with the flood index in the basin.
sentences.chinese: 最后，对信江流域洪涝指数作了预报试验。

sentences.english: Characteristics of the atmospheric general circulation during the catastrophic floods over the Changjiang-Huaihe River Valley(CHRV) are investigated.
sentences.chinese: 文中研究了江淮流域特大洪涝的环流特征。

sentences.english: Prior to its construction, the Chengdu plain was prone to flooding in the winter and drought in the summer.
sentences.chinese: 在有都江堰之前，成都平原夏有旱灾，冬有洪涝。

sentences.english: Almost every year, there are floods or waterlog in our country, and the PLA often fights the disasters.
sentences.chinese: 我国是个洪涝灾害多发国家，军队参加抗洪抢险频繁。

sentences.english: Extreme droughts and extreme floods can’t both be due to climate change.
sentences.chinese: 极端干旱和极端洪涝并非都源于气候变暖。

sentences.english: Flood monitoring and estimation is one of the main tasks of crop condition monitoring.
sentences.chinese: 洪涝灾害的监测与评估是农情监测的主要任务之一。

sentences.english: The endurance of younger maizes was weaker than old ones.
sentences.chinese: 玉米苗越小，耐洪涝的能力越弱。

sentences.english: More floods will happen in the cities and towns along the major rivers.
sentences.chinese: 沿主河道的城镇将遭受更多的洪涝灾害。

sentences.english: The remaining patients with flood-related colds and skin diseases.
sentences.chinese: 其余患者为与洪涝灾害有关的感冒和皮肤病。

sentences.english: Forecasters have speculated that the most substantial damage may come from flooding.
sentences.chinese: 预报人员曾猜测，最大的破坏可能来自于洪涝。

sentences.english: Record-size snowpack and heavy flooding have affected the area recently.
sentences.chinese: 记录大小的积雪和严重洪涝影响的地区。

sentences.english: The flood- waterlogging of Jinhua- Quzhou Basin has a time fractal structure.
sentences.chinese: 金衢盆地的洪涝具有时间分形结构。

definition: disaster-stricken/to be hit by a natural calamity
